p2.l2: are the foundation of tomorrow's experiences

intro: From agentic LLMs, to multimodal agents, to reinforcement learning solutions.
Plus, my passion for research and innovation.
portfolio: I have worked with organizations such as: AWS, University of Michigan, Oakland University, Human-AI Lab.
Here are some of my most impactful projects.

intro: I'm currently pursuing B.S.E. Computer Science with focus on Intelligent Systems and Minor in Mathematics at University of Michigan (GPA: 3.555). Previously completed B.S. Computer Science with AI specialization at Oakland University (Honors College, GPA: 3.92).
My journey into AI began with deep learning research, and today I work at the intersection of machine learning, reinforcement learning, and natural language processing.
I'm passionate about building agentic systems that can reason, learn, and assist humans in meaningful ways.
From academic research to production systems at AWS, I've explored the full spectrum of AI development.
Today I think in PyTorch and transformers.
clan: At the UMich Human-AI Lab, I investigate accessibility-aware computer-use agents, exploring how AI can better serve users with diverse needs.
My work on multimodal web agents extended DeepSeek R1 with audio, vision, and persistent memory, achieving significant performance improvements on WebShop (+7pp) and WebArena (+9pp).
At AWS, I built production agentic LLM systems achieving 24× speed improvement with 95.8% efficiency boost at 99%+ accuracy.
I've published research on secure UAV communication using LLMs (ICCCN 2024), edge-consistent temporal stabilization for portrait matting, and LLM-based network security (EdgeSP 2023).
method:
Building effective AI systems requires more than just model architecture and training pipelines.
The real impact comes from understanding user needs, system constraints, and ethical implications.

I emphasize rigorous experimentation
and reproducible research

I promote collaborative development,
knowledge sharing,
and open-source contributions
When research leads to real-world impact and published work, it's even more rewarding.
skills: Languages: Python, C, C++, Java, HTML, CSS, SQL, SQLite, JavaScript, MATLAB, TypeScript
Technologies: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas, AWS, Flask, Hugging Face, JMavSim, PX4 Autopilot, Unreal Engine, NVIDIA Omniverse, Human-Robot Interaction, Git, REST APIs, React, DOM, CUDA, RAG, FAISS
Expertise: Deep Neural Networks (CNNs, RNNs, LSTM), Reinforcement Learning, Computer Vision, NLP, ML Optimization, System Design

teaching: Computer Science and Engineering Dept. Grader – Oakland University (January 2024 – April 2024)
Evaluated and graded assignments, quizzes, and examinations for undergraduate students in CSI 2470 – Introduction to Computer Networks.
Aided in conducting interactive and engaging lab sessions, providing students with hands-on experience.
Enabled student learning through personalized consultations, addressing queries on course content, assignments, and projects, fostering a supportive, collaborative environment.

Collaborated with instructors and teaching assistants to ensure consistency and accuracy in grading while upholding academic integrity.
